column4: Windows is working just fine etc so i doubt it's any of my hardware
Well, if linux forces me to unplug my HD I don't see why I would want to install it anyway... and on what drive would I install it then? =)
Why would the live-cd even want to touch my HD? And the HD is working just fine, I've used chkdsk etc
Just after i press enter on "Start Ubuntu (install)"
and then It starts to load stuff, and there is when it crashes
and chkdisk in windows thinks it fine
i'm 99,9% sure it's no the hd
i'm 99,99% sure there are NO bad clusters on my HD =)
all hard drives have clusters that are bad, thats why its not the full 60GB but it is really 57GB
It's because manufacturers count a kb as 1000b and the computer counts it as 1024b
When I hit enter on the Ubuntu CD that I ordered and select live/install, it brings me back to the Ubuntu CD Splash screen. Why is that?
So... I take it no one has any ideas then...? =/
what is your issue? PM please
I can't pm you because of the security...
